perturbation.original_text:
During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume (“MAOV”) of [***] (“Units”) for
the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period
commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage’s [***] facility and approval
of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December
31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a “Contract Period”).
perturbation.changed_text:
During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall endeavor to purchase a Recommended Annual Order Volume (“RAOV”) of [***] (“Units”) for
the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The RAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period
commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage’s [***] facility and approval
of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December
31, 2022, Premier may purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a “Contract Period”).
perturbation.explanation: The change from “Minimum Annual Order Volume (MAOV)” which implies a legal obligation to “Recommended Annual Order Volume (RAOV)” changes the nature of the commitment from mandatory to advisory. Also, changing the wording 'shall be required' to 'endeavor to purchase' makes this volume not obligatory. In addition, changing the wording 'will be required to purchase' to 'may purchase' makes the annual amount of units to not obligatory as well.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - specifically relating to the enforceability of agreements based on clear obligations. Changing “shall” to “may” undermines the obligatory nature of the agreement.
